item.title: Loral's Evil Agenda, Summer 2007
item.description: This week Loral writes up his latest Evil Agenda with a plan to deliver it to Sony Online Entertainment at Gencon 2007.

item.title: Are Portable MMOs the Future?
item.description: Today Loral pontificates the future of MMOs in the portable gaming world. Could it be the next big leap in massive online gaming.

item.title: The Barriers of Online Gaming
item.description: This week Loral takes a look at the difficulties faced by game developers on game focus for those lost in the chasm between hard core gamers and part-time casual gamers.

item.title: What Does a Yearly Expansion Cycle Mean for Everquest?
item.description: This week Loral takes a look at the repercussions from SOE's announcement that it intends to release expansions yearly instead of twice-yearly.

item.title: Is SOE Abandoning Everquest?
item.description: Today Loral answers a question on the minds of many current Everquest players. Is Everquest dead yet? Is it dying? Has SOE forgotten the face of its father? Is SOE abandoing Everquest? Let us ponder the matters at hand.

item.title: A Late, Incomplete, and Pessimistic Review of the Buried Sea
item.description: Loral takes a micro-slice of the Buried Sea, examines it in a little petri dish, and doesn't like what he finds.

item.title: New Player Models in Everquest
item.description: After seven years, Everquest finally receives the new player models it so richly deserves. They may not look great but the performance should be spectacular!

item.title: The Overhead of Social Gaming
item.description: Today Loral goes on a bit of a rant, describing the inherant overhead and difficulty associated with multiplayer gaming. Sometimes it's good to be alone.

item.title: Anatomy of a Quest
item.description: Today Loral takes a look at the changes in quest systems over the years and helps clarify what separates a good quest from a bad one.

item.title: Preview of the Buried Sea
item.description: This week Loral takes an extended tour through the new lands found in Everquest's thirteenth expansion, the Buried Sea.

item.title: World of Warcraft: The Burning Crusade
item.description: Loral takes a step out of the world of Norrath and spends a time in the world of Azeroth and the recently opened portal to the Outlands in today's discussion of the first World of Warcraft expansion, the Burning Crusade.

item.title: EQ Expansion 13: The Buried Sea
item.description: Today Loral takes a look at the little information we have on Everquest's 13th expansion, The Buried Sea.

item.title: Massive Online Games of 2007
item.description: Loral steps back and pontificates the entire playing field of 2007 massive online game releases.

item.title: Everquest's Two Year Outlook
item.description: Today Loral takes a look out over the next two years and predicts what we may see change across the world of Norrath.

item.title: The State of the Equipment Gap
item.description: Today Loral takes a look at the current state of the equipment power gap between raiders and single-group hunters at the highest levels after the release of The Serpent's Spine.
